page.title: 08Employment in Stirling
page.content: We did a small survey in Stirling. We interviewed thirty-five people. Five of them were unemployed. They had dismal views of the prospect of finding a job. They had been out of work from four months to one year. Of those who were employed two were manual workers, five were professional persons, six worked in offices and seventeen gave a service to the public. For High School pupils and students there are many casual jobs such as babysitting, delivery of newspapers, milk, advertisement leaflets; restocking shelves and pricing items in department stores. These casual jobs subsidise them until they leave school. This year it is expected that a lot of small shops will have to close down because of the revaluation of rates.
